components.description: An emoji to depict a wedding, displayed by most vendors as a Christian church and love hearts. Some platforms display a cross or bell on the building.
components.title: Wedding

description: An emoji to depict a wedding, displayed by most vendors as a Christian church and love hearts. Some platforms display a cross or bell on the building.
title: Wedding

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Romance symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A church building with a love heart above it, symbolising a wedding inside the building, usually with bride and groom. Wedding was approved  http://emojipedia.org/wedding/
emoji_net_data.name: wedding

bn:00090675v: To unite in wedlock or matrimony; to perform the ceremony of joining spouses; to bring about a marital union according to the laws or customs of a place.
To perform the marriage ceremony for; to join in matrimony.

bn:00017719n: Religious place of fellowship, prayer and worship

In English English a building used for church services which is not a parish church or cathedral church of a diocese and so by extension, now obsolescent, a name also used for a church of a nonconformist denomination
A place of worship, smaller than, or subordinate to a church.
A chapel is a religious place of fellowship, prayer and worship that is attached to a larger, often nonreligious institution or that is considered an extension of a primary religious institution.
A place of worship that has its own altar

bn:00018995n: A place for public (especially Christian) worship
Is a building used for religious activities, particularly Christian worship service
A church building, often simply called a church, is a building used for religious activities, particularly worship services.
A building where Christian religious activities take place.
A Christian house of worship; a building where religious services take place.

bn:00053518n: The state of being married; matrimony.
Marriage; the state of being married.
The act or state of marriage.
Conflict of marriage laws is the conflict of laws regarding marriage in different jurisdictions.
The state of being a married couple voluntarily joined for life (or until divorce)

bn:00045458n: A ceremony celebrating the beginning of a marriage, during which the marrying parties exchanges vows.
The social event at which the ceremony of marriage is performed
Marriage ceremony; ritual officially celebrating the beginning of a marriage.
A wedding; a ceremony in which people wed.
A wedding is a ceremony where people are united in marriage.
Ceremony where people are united in marriage
